alert.note: Alert for Bradley; Calhoun; Union (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 20 at 8:12PM CDT until further notice by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Arkansas... Black River At Black Rock affecting Jackson, Lawrence and Independence Counties. Ouachita River At Thatcher L&D affecting Calhoun, Union and Bradley Counties. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Arkansas... Ouachita River At Camden affecting Ouachita and Calhoun Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Ouachita River At Thatcher L&D. * WHEN...Until further notice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 85.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is currently cresting near 85.3 feet, and will then begin to slowly fall again by Sunday afternoon to near 83.3 feet by Tuesday evening. - Flood stage is 79.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecast 7 PM Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sun Mon Tue Crest Time Date Ouachita River Thatcher L&D 79.0 85.3 Sat 7 PM 84.9 84.2 83.3 **CRESTING** &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
